short_description: This function generates combinations of frequent baskets
long_description: This function is used for identifying the associations in two item-set. For every combination, this function generates the score, support, confidence and z-score associated with the combination

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the data to filter.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the data to filter.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table that the function creates. The table must not exist.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table that the function creates. The table must not exist.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain the data to filter.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain the data to filter.

argument_clauses.name: JoinColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to join.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns to join.

argument_clauses.name: AddColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table. The function partitions the input data and the output table on these columns. By default, the function treats the input data as belonging to one partition. Note: Specifying a column as both an add_column and a join_column causes incorrect counts in partitions.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table. The function partitions the input data and the output table on these columns. By default, the function treats the input data as belonging to one partition. Note: Specifying a column as both an add_column and a join_column causes incorrect counts in partitions.

argument_clauses.name: PartitionKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the output column to use as the partition key. The default value is 'col1_item1'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the output column to use as the partition key. The default value is 'col1_item1'.

argument_clauses.name: MaxItemSet
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum size of the item set. The default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum size of the item set. The default value is 100.
